commands.name: Step 1: Deploy v1 via ArgoCD
commands.description: Deploy the initial version of the application
commands.explanation: Creates the ArgoCD Application pointing to the manifests with nginx:1.20-alpine (v1). Since there's no auto-sync, you'll need to sync manually.
commands.next_step: Sync the application to deploy v1.

commands.name: Step 2: Sync v1
commands.description: Manually sync in ArgoCD UI to deploy v1
commands.explanation: Use the ArgoCD UI to sync. You'll see the resources being created. Once synced, all pods should run nginx:1.20-alpine.
commands.what_it_does: Triggers manual sync of v1 deployment.
info_steps: Open ArgoCD UI (use the button above)
Watch the resources being created — once done, all pods run nginx:1.20-alpine

commands.name: Step 3: Verify v1 Running
commands.command: kubectl get pods -n argocd-sc-07 -o jsonpath='{.items[*].spec.containers[*].image}' | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u
commands.explanation: All pods should show nginx:1.20-alpine. This is our baseline v1 deployment.
commands.what_it_does: Shows container images to confirm v1.
commands.next_step: Simulate a v2 update by patching the deployment image.

commands.name: Step 4: Simulate v2 Update (Direct Patch)
commands.command: kubectl set image deployment/rollback-app app=nginx:1.21-alpine -n argocd-sc-07 && kubectl get pods -n argocd-sc-07 -o jsonpath='{.items[*].spec.containers[*].image}' | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u
commands.description: Update the deployment image to simulate a new version
commands.explanation: We directly patch the deployment to nginx:1.21-alpine. This creates drift between the live state and Git. ArgoCD will detect this as 'OutOfSync'.
commands.what_it_does: Updates the deployment to v2, creating drift from Git.
commands.next_step: Check ArgoCD - it should show OutOfSync.

commands.name: Step 5: Observe Drift in ArgoCD
commands.description: View the drift detection in ArgoCD UI
commands.explanation: ArgoCD detected that the live deployment differs from Git. The APP DIFF view shows exactly what changed (image tag). In a real GitOps workflow, you'd revert by syncing back to Git state.
commands.what_it_does: Shows drift detection between live state and Git desired state.
commands.next_step: Rollback to v1 by syncing ArgoCD (reverting to Git state).
info_steps: Open ArgoCD UI (use the button above)
Click APP DIFF to see exactly what changed (the image tag from 1.20 to 1.21)
This is ArgoCD's drift detection — it knows the live state no longer matches Git

commands.name: Step 6: Rollback via ArgoCD Sync
commands.description: Sync in ArgoCD to rollback to v1 (Git state)
commands.explanation: Syncing re-applies the Git manifests, reverting the image back to nginx:1.20-alpine. This is GitOps rollback - the Git repo is always the source of truth. No need for 'kubectl rollout undo'.
commands.what_it_does: Reverts deployment to Git state via ArgoCD sync.
info_steps: Open ArgoCD UI (use the button above)
ArgoCD re-applies the Git manifests, reverting the image back to nginx:1.20-alpine — GitOps rollback with no kubectl rollout undo needed!

commands.name: Step 7: Verify Rollback
commands.command: kubectl get pods -n argocd-sc-07 -o jsonpath='{.items[*].spec.containers[*].image}' | tr ' ' '\n' | sort -u && echo '' && kubectl get application sc07-rollback -n argocd -o jsonpath='Sync: {.status.sync.status}'
commands.description: Confirm pods are back on v1
commands.explanation: Images should show nginx:1.20-alpine again, and sync status should be 'Synced'. The rollback was instant and declarative - ArgoCD simply enforced the Git state.
commands.what_it_does: Confirms rollback to v1 was successful.

commands.name: Step 8: View Sync History
commands.description: View sync history in ArgoCD - shows all revisions
commands.explanation: ArgoCD keeps a history of all sync operations. You can rollback to any previous sync revision through the UI. This is more powerful than kubectl rollout history because it covers ALL resources, not just deployments.
commands.what_it_does: Shows sync history and revision tracking.
commands.next_step: Scenario complete! Clean up when ready.
info_steps: Open ArgoCD UI (use the button above)
You can see all sync operations — and roll back to any previous revision from this tab

commands.name: Cleanup: Delete Application
commands.command: kubectl delete application sc07-rollback -n argocd && kubectl delete namespace argocd-sc-07 --ignore-not-found
commands.explanation: Deletes the ArgoCD application and cleans up all resources.
